lead_paragraph: CUEVAS--Louis, July 26, 1928 - April 10, 2016. "Lou," Broadcast pioneer, died from complications following open heart surgery. Son of Joseph and Estelle Cuevas of the Bronx, Lou was a graphic artist on NBC's "Today." Featured as a creator on the 60th Anniversary Show in 2012, Lou also drew "Rebus" puzzles for "Concentration" and retired at 80 from ABC's "Good Morning America" and "Nightline." A Korean War Army veteran, Lou was married to Catherine Nicastri from 1965 until her death in 2013. Lou is survived by daughter Caroline Keck and son-in-law Albert, four grandchildren Lexi and husband Kyle, Julie, Paul, and Carlin, and by cousin Rex Phelps and family. On his wife's side, Lou is survived by brothers and sisters-in-law, Dr. Tony and Ann Nicastri, their four children Ruthann Pennybacher, Tina McKenzie, Dr. Cathy Dickhuth, and Dr. Dan Nicastri, their spouses, and eight- grandnieces/nephews. Lou will also be missed by companion Sue Rothberger and many extended family/friends. A lover of life and witty conversationalist, Lou made lifelong friends everywhere. The single common denominator this diverse group shares is a deep love and admiration for the unique character known as Lou. A Memorial will be held at 1pm on Saturday, June 25 at Manhattan Penthouse on Fifth. 1/3
